bioghist.p: Among the exemplary collections of the Free Library of Philadelphia is the Print and Picture Collection. Spanning the graphic arts from 1493 to the present time, the Free Library's Fine Art Prints and Photographs collection includes thousands of images. Initially representing only Philadelphia artists, the collection has been extended to include early masters as well as renowned modern printmakers and photographers.

scopecontent.p: Posters in the collection include: posters for art exhibitions at Philadelphia area museums, art schools, and galleries, and a few from other locations; National Library Week posters; Free Library of Philadelphia posters and placards; posters for various book exhibitions and festivals, and music and dance performances; views of Philadelphia; travel posters; psychedelic posters (including several by Peter Max); advertising posters (Apple Computer, several airlines); humorous posters; and book illustrations.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
